citation.article-title: Vibrio gallaecicus sp. nov. isolated from cultured clams in north-western Spain

p.s: Description of Vibrio gallaecicus sp nov.
V. gallaecicus [gal.la.e’ci.cus. N.L. masc. adj. gallaecicus, pertaining to Gallaecia (Galicia), the north-western region of Spain].
Cells are Gram-negative rods, motile and facultatively anaerobic.
Colonies are round with smooth margins, beige in colour and non-swarming on MA plates.
Strains grow on TCBS agar.
Strain VB 5.12 grows forming 1–1.5 mm yellow colonies, whereas strains VB 8.9T and C 8.10 produce 1–1.2 mm green colonies after incubation for 1 day at 24 °C.
Glucose metabolism is fermentative without gas production.
Strains reduce nitrates to nitrites.
Oxidase and catalase tests are positive.
Strains are sensitive to the vibriostatic agent O/129 (150 μg per disc) and resistant to ampicillin (10 μg per disc).
All strains grow at 4 °C and require NaCl for growth.
The optimal NaCl concentration for growth is 1–3% (w/v) and strains do not grow above a concentration of 6% NaCl.
Not luminescent.
All strains are negative for arginine dihydrolase, and lysine and ornithine decarboxylases, ONPG, Voges–Proskauer reaction, use of citrate and hydrolysis of urea.
Indole and methyl red are positive.
All strains hydrolyse starch, gelatin and Tween 80 but not alginate.
All strains are positive for DNase and aesculin activities.

Acid is produced from: glycerol, D-ribose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, D-cellobiose, D-maltose, D-trehalose, glycogen, potassium gluconate and potassium 2-ketogluconate.

None of the strains produce acid from erythritol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-xylose, L-xylose, D-adonitol, methyl-αD-xylopranoside, D-galactose, L-sorbose, L-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, D-sorbitol, methyl-αD-mannopyranoside, methyl-αD-glucopyranoside, arbutin, salicin, D-lactose (bovine origin), D-melibiose, inulin, D-melezitose, D-raffinose, gentiobiose, D-turanose, D-lyxose, D-tagatose, D-fucose, L-fucose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol and potassium 5-ketogluconate.
API ZYM reaction tests were positive in all strains for alkaline phosphatase, butyrate esterase, esterase lipase and leucine arylamidase.
The type strain VB 8.9T (=CECT 7224T, =LMG 24045T) was isolated from clams R. philippinarum on the north-western coast of Spain.
The GenBank accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequences of V. gallaecicus strains VB 8.9T, VB 5.12 and C 8.10 are EU541605, EU541613 and EU541612.

The GenBank accession numbers for the rpoA, recA, atpA and pyrH gene sequences of strains VB 8.9T, VB 5.12 and C 8.10 are EU541566, EU931118, EU541582, EU541587, EU931114, EU541582, EU541559, EU931119, EU541560, EU871963, EU871965 and EU871964, respectively.

The GenBank accession numbers for the recA, rpoA and atpA gene sequences of strains Vibrio gigantis DSM 18531T and Vibrio crassostreae LMG 22240T are EU541593, EU541594, EU541573, EU541574, EU541556 and EU541557, respectively.
The GenBank accession number for the atpA gene sequence of strain Vibrio lentus CECT5110T is EU541558.

The GenBank accession numbers for the pyrH gene sequences of strains V. cyclitrophicus LMG 21359T, V. pomeroyi LMG 20537T, V. lentus CECT 5110T, V. gigantis DSM 18531T, V. crassostreae LMG 22240T, V. tasmaniensis LMG 21574T and V. splendidus LMG 19031T are EU871958, EU871960, EU871958, EU871951, EU871948, EU871961 and EU871962, respectively.
